â•â•â•¡ EXCEPTION CAUGHT BY WIDGETS LIBRARY â•žâ•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•
The following ProviderNotFoundException was thrown building
HomeScreen-[LabeledGlobalKey<NavigatorState>#53226](dirty, dependencies: [InheritedCupertinoTheme,
MediaQuery, _InheritedTheme, _LocalizationsScope-[GlobalKey#49179]], state:
_HomeScreenState#9d1e8(tickers: tracking 3 tickers)):
Error: Could not find the correct Provider<ThemeProvider> above this HomeScreen Widget

This happens because you used a `BuildContext` that does not include the provider
of your choice. There are a few common scenarios:

- You added a new provider in your `main.dart` and performed a hot-reload.
  To fix, perform a hot-restart.

- The provider you are trying to read is in a different route.

  Providers are "scoped". So if you insert of provider inside a route, then
  other routes will not be able to access that provider.

- You used a `BuildContext` that is an ancestor of the provider you are trying to read.

  Make sure that HomeScreen is under your MultiProvider/Provider<ThemeProvider>.
  This usually happens when you are creating a provider and trying to read it immediately.

  For example, instead of:

  ```
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return Provider<Example>(
      create: (_) => Example(),
      // Will throw a ProviderNotFoundError, because `context` is associated
      // to the widget that is the parent of `Provider<Example>`
      child: Text(context.watch<Example>().toString()),
    );
  }
  ```

  consider using `builder` like so:

  ```
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return Provider<Example>(
      create: (_) => Example(),
      // we use `builder` to obtain a new `BuildContext` that has access to the provider
      builder: (context, child) {
        // No longer throws
        return Text(context.watch<Example>().toString());
      }
    );
  }
  ```

If none of these solutions work, consider asking for help on StackOverflow:
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/flutter

â•â•â•¡ EXCEPTION CAUGHT BY WIDGETS LIBRARY â•žâ•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•
The following ProviderNotFoundException was thrown building
HomeScreen-[LabeledGlobalKey<NavigatorState>#ef895](dirty, dependencies: [InheritedCupertinoTheme,
MediaQuery, _InheritedTheme, _LocalizationsScope-[GlobalKey#d00d6]], state:
_HomeScreenState#832fb(tickers: tracking 3 tickers)):
Error: Could not find the correct Provider<ThemeProvider> above this HomeScreen Widget

This happens because you used a `BuildContext` that does not include the provider
of your choice. There are a few common scenarios:

- You added a new provider in your `main.dart` and performed a hot-reload.
  To fix, perform a hot-restart.

- The provider you are trying to read is in a different route.

  Providers are "scoped". So if you insert of provider inside a route, then
  other routes will not be able to access that provider.

- You used a `BuildContext` that is an ancestor of the provider you are trying to read.

  Make sure that HomeScreen is under your MultiProvider/Provider<ThemeProvider>.
  This usually happens when you are creating a provider and trying to read it immediately.

  For example, instead of:

  ```
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return Provider<Example>(
      create: (_) => Example(),
      // Will throw a ProviderNotFoundError, because `context` is associated
      // to the widget that is the parent of `Provider<Example>`
      child: Text(context.watch<Example>().toString()),
    );
  }
  ```

  consider using `builder` like so:

  ```
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return Provider<Example>(
      create: (_) => Example(),
      // we use `builder` to obtain a new `BuildContext` that has access to the provider
      builder: (context, child) {
        // No longer throws
        return Text(context.watch<Example>().toString());
      }
    );
  }
  ```

If none of these solutions work, consider asking for help on StackOverflow:
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/flutter

â•â•â•¡ EXCEPTION CAUGHT BY WIDGETS LIBRARY â•žâ•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•
The following ProviderNotFoundException was thrown building
HomeScreen-[LabeledGlobalKey<NavigatorState>#9eb8c](dirty, dependencies: [InheritedCupertinoTheme,
MediaQuery, _InheritedTheme, _LocalizationsScope-[GlobalKey#5cb62]], state:
_HomeScreenState#c6877(tickers: tracking 3 tickers)):
Error: Could not find the correct Provider<ThemeProvider> above this HomeScreen Widget

This happens because you used a `BuildContext` that does not include the provider
of your choice. There are a few common scenarios:

- You added a new provider in your `main.dart` and performed a hot-reload.
  To fix, perform a hot-restart.

- The provider you are trying to read is in a different route.

  Providers are "scoped". So if you insert of provider inside a route, then
  other routes will not be able to access that provider.

- You used a `BuildContext` that is an ancestor of the provider you are trying to read.

  Make sure that HomeScreen is under your MultiProvider/Provider<ThemeProvider>.
  This usually happens when you are creating a provider and trying to read it immediately.

  For example, instead of:

  ```
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return Provider<Example>(
      create: (_) => Example(),
      // Will throw a ProviderNotFoundError, because `context` is associated
      // to the widget that is the parent of `Provider<Example>`
      child: Text(context.watch<Example>().toString()),
    );
  }
  ```

  consider using `builder` like so:

  ```
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return Provider<Example>(
      create: (_) => Example(),
      // we use `builder` to obtain a new `BuildContext` that has access to the provider
      builder: (context, child) {
        // No longer throws
        return Text(context.watch<Example>().toString());
      }
    );
  }
  ```

If none of these solutions work, consider asking for help on StackOverflow:
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/flutter

â•â•â•¡ EXCEPTION CAUGHT BY WIDGETS LIBRARY â•žâ•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•
The following ProviderNotFoundException was thrown building
HomeScreen-[LabeledGlobalKey<NavigatorState>#4d084](dirty, dependencies: [InheritedCupertinoTheme,
MediaQuery, _InheritedTheme, _LocalizationsScope-[GlobalKey#5131f]], state:
_HomeScreenState#33e3c(tickers: tracking 3 tickers)):
Error: Could not find the correct Provider<ThemeProvider> above this HomeScreen Widget

This happens because you used a `BuildContext` that does not include the provider
of your choice. There are a few common scenarios:

- You added a new provider in your `main.dart` and performed a hot-reload.
  To fix, perform a hot-restart.

- The provider you are trying to read is in a different route.

  Providers are "scoped". So if you insert of provider inside a route, then
  other routes will not be able to access that provider.

- You used a `BuildContext` that is an ancestor of the provider you are trying to read.

  Make sure that HomeScreen is under your MultiProvider/Provider<ThemeProvider>.
  This usually happens when you are creating a provider and trying to read it immediately.

  For example, instead of:

  ```
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return Provider<Example>(
      create: (_) => Example(),
      // Will throw a ProviderNotFoundError, because `context` is associated
      // to the widget that is the parent of `Provider<Example>`
      child: Text(context.watch<Example>().toString()),
    );
  }
  ```

  consider using `builder` like so:

  ```
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return Provider<Example>(
      create: (_) => Example(),
      // we use `builder` to obtain a new `BuildContext` that has access to the provider
      builder: (context, child) {
        // No longer throws
        return Text(context.watch<Example>().toString());
      }
    );
  }
  ```

If none of these solutions work, consider asking for help on StackOverflow:
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/flutter

The following ProviderNotFoundException was thrown building
HomeScreen-[LabeledGlobalKey<NavigatorState>#1d372](dirty, dependencies: [InheritedCupertinoTheme,
MediaQuery, _InheritedTheme, _LocalizationsScope-[GlobalKey#02293]], state:
_HomeScreenState#3fecf(tickers: tracking 3 tickers)):
Error: Could not find the correct Provider<ThemeProvider> above this HomeScreen Widget

This happens because you used a `BuildContext` that does not include the provider
of your choice. There are a few common scenarios:

- You added a new provider in your `main.dart` and performed a hot-reload.
  To fix, perform a hot-restart.

- The provider you are trying to read is in a different route.

  Providers are "scoped". So if you insert of provider inside a route, then
  other routes will not be able to access that provider.

- You used a `BuildContext` that is an ancestor of the provider you are trying to read.

  Make sure that HomeScreen is under your MultiProvider/Provider<ThemeProvider>.
  This usually happens when you are creating a provider and trying to read it immediately.

  For example, instead of:

  ```
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return Provider<Example>(
      create: (_) => Example(),
      // Will throw a ProviderNotFoundError, because `context` is associated
      // to the widget that is the parent of `Provider<Example>`
      child: Text(context.watch<Example>().toString()),
    );
  }
  ```

  consider using `builder` like so:

  ```
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return Provider<Example>(
      create: (_) => Example(),
      // we use `builder` to obtain a new `BuildContext` that has access to the provider
      builder: (context, child) {
        // No longer throws
        return Text(context.watch<Example>().toString());
      }
    );
  }
  ```

If none of these solutions work, consider asking for help on StackOverflow:
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/flutter

â•â•â•¡ EXCEPTION CAUGHT BY WIDGETS LIBRARY â•žâ•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•
The following ProviderNotFoundException was thrown building
HomeScreen-[LabeledGlobalKey<NavigatorState>#6f3f9](dirty, dependencies: [InheritedCupertinoTheme,
MediaQuery, _InheritedTheme, _LocalizationsScope-[GlobalKey#c0302]], state:
_HomeScreenState#ff001(tickers: tracking 3 tickers)):
Error: Could not find the correct Provider<ThemeProvider> above this HomeScreen Widget

This happens because you used a `BuildContext` that does not include the provider
of your choice. There are a few common scenarios:

- You added a new provider in your `main.dart` and performed a hot-reload.
  To fix, perform a hot-restart.

- The provider you are trying to read is in a different route.

  Providers are "scoped". So if you insert of provider inside a route, then
  other routes will not be able to access that provider.

- You used a `BuildContext` that is an ancestor of the provider you are trying to read.

  Make sure that HomeScreen is under your MultiProvider/Provider<ThemeProvider>.
  This usually happens when you are creating a provider and trying to read it immediately.

  For example, instead of:

  ```
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return Provider<Example>(
      create: (_) => Example(),
      // Will throw a ProviderNotFoundError, because `context` is associated
      // to the widget that is the parent of `Provider<Example>`
      child: Text(context.watch<Example>().toString()),
    );
  }
  ```

  consider using `builder` like so:

  ```
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return Provider<Example>(
      create: (_) => Example(),
      // we use `builder` to obtain a new `BuildContext` that has access to the provider
      builder: (context, child) {
        // No longer throws
        return Text(context.watch<Example>().toString());
      }
    );
  }
  ```

If none of these solutions work, consider asking for help on StackOverflow:
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/flutter

The following ProviderNotFoundException was thrown building
HomeScreen-[LabeledGlobalKey<NavigatorState>#1a066](dirty, dependencies: [InheritedCupertinoTheme,
MediaQuery, _InheritedTheme, _LocalizationsScope-[GlobalKey#ecf95]], state:
_HomeScreenState#2fc74(tickers: tracking 3 tickers)):
Error: Could not find the correct Provider<ThemeProvider> above this HomeScreen Widget

This happens because you used a `BuildContext` that does not include the provider
of your choice. There are a few common scenarios:

- You added a new provider in your `main.dart` and performed a hot-reload.
  To fix, perform a hot-restart.

- The provider you are trying to read is in a different route.

  Providers are "scoped". So if you insert of provider inside a route, then
  other routes will not be able to access that provider.

- You used a `BuildContext` that is an ancestor of the provider you are trying to read.

  Make sure that HomeScreen is under your MultiProvider/Provider<ThemeProvider>.
  This usually happens when you are creating a provider and trying to read it immediately.

  For example, instead of:

  ```
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return Provider<Example>(
      create: (_) => Example(),
      // Will throw a ProviderNotFoundError, because `context` is associated
      // to the widget that is the parent of `Provider<Example>`
      child: Text(context.watch<Example>().toString()),
    );
  }
  ```

  consider using `builder` like so:

  ```
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return Provider<Example>(
      create: (_) => Example(),
      // we use `builder` to obtain a new `BuildContext` that has access to the provider
      builder: (context, child) {
        // No longer throws
        return Text(context.watch<Example>().toString());
      }
    );
  }
  ```

If none of these solutions work, consider asking for help on StackOverflow:
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/flutter

â•â•â•¡ EXCEPTION CAUGHT BY WIDGETS LIBRARY â•žâ•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•
The following ProviderNotFoundException was thrown building
HomeScreen-[LabeledGlobalKey<NavigatorState>#59c42](dirty, dependencies: [InheritedCupertinoTheme,
MediaQuery, _InheritedTheme, _LocalizationsScope-[GlobalKey#05048]], state:
_HomeScreenState#75ace(tickers: tracking 3 tickers)):
Error: Could not find the correct Provider<ThemeProvider> above this HomeScreen Widget

This happens because you used a `BuildContext` that does not include the provider
of your choice. There are a few common scenarios:

- You added a new provider in your `main.dart` and performed a hot-reload.
  To fix, perform a hot-restart.

- The provider you are trying to read is in a different route.

  Providers are "scoped". So if you insert of provider inside a route, then
  other routes will not be able to access that provider.

- You used a `BuildContext` that is an ancestor of the provider you are trying to read.

  Make sure that HomeScreen is under your MultiProvider/Provider<ThemeProvider>.
  This usually happens when you are creating a provider and trying to read it immediately.

  For example, instead of:

  ```
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return Provider<Example>(
      create: (_) => Example(),
      // Will throw a ProviderNotFoundError, because `context` is associated
      // to the widget that is the parent of `Provider<Example>`
      child: Text(context.watch<Example>().toString()),
    );
  }
  ```

  consider using `builder` like so:

  ```
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return Provider<Example>(
      create: (_) => Example(),
      // we use `builder` to obtain a new `BuildContext` that has access to the provider
      builder: (context, child) {
        // No longer throws
        return Text(context.watch<Example>().toString());
      }
    );
  }
  ```

If none of these solutions work, consider asking for help on StackOverflow:
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/flutter

â•â•â•¡ EXCEPTION CAUGHT BY WIDGETS LIBRARY â•žâ•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•
The following ProviderNotFoundException was thrown building
HomeScreen-[LabeledGlobalKey<NavigatorState>#5c991](dirty, dependencies: [InheritedCupertinoTheme,
MediaQuery, _InheritedTheme, _LocalizationsScope-[GlobalKey#271cc]], state:
_HomeScreenState#76186(tickers: tracking 3 tickers)):
Error: Could not find the correct Provider<ThemeProvider> above this HomeScreen Widget

This happens because you used a `BuildContext` that does not include the provider
of your choice. There are a few common scenarios:

- You added a new provider in your `main.dart` and performed a hot-reload.
  To fix, perform a hot-restart.

- The provider you are trying to read is in a different route.

  Providers are "scoped". So if you insert of provider inside a route, then
  other routes will not be able to access that provider.

- You used a `BuildContext` that is an ancestor of the provider you are trying to read.

  Make sure that HomeScreen is under your MultiProvider/Provider<ThemeProvider>.
  This usually happens when you are creating a provider and trying to read it immediately.

  For example, instead of:

  ```
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return Provider<Example>(
      create: (_) => Example(),
      // Will throw a ProviderNotFoundError, because `context` is associated
      // to the widget that is the parent of `Provider<Example>`
      child: Text(context.watch<Example>().toString()),
    );
  }
  ```

  consider using `builder` like so:

  ```
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return Provider<Example>(
      create: (_) => Example(),
      // we use `builder` to obtain a new `BuildContext` that has access to the provider
      builder: (context, child) {
        // No longer throws
        return Text(context.watch<Example>().toString());
      }
    );
  }
  ```

If none of these solutions work, consider asking for help on StackOverflow:
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/flutter

â•â•â•¡ EXCEPTION CAUGHT BY WIDGETS LIBRARY â•žâ•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•
The following ProviderNotFoundException was thrown building
HomeScreen-[LabeledGlobalKey<NavigatorState>#e4193](dirty, dependencies: [InheritedCupertinoTheme,
MediaQuery, _InheritedTheme, _LocalizationsScope-[GlobalKey#ba915]], state:
_HomeScreenState#74672(tickers: tracking 3 tickers)):
Error: Could not find the correct Provider<ThemeProvider> above this HomeScreen Widget

This happens because you used a `BuildContext` that does not include the provider
of your choice. There are a few common scenarios:

- You added a new provider in your `main.dart` and performed a hot-reload.
  To fix, perform a hot-restart.

- The provider you are trying to read is in a different route.

  Providers are "scoped". So if you insert of provider inside a route, then
  other routes will not be able to access that provider.

- You used a `BuildContext` that is an ancestor of the provider you are trying to read.

  Make sure that HomeScreen is under your MultiProvider/Provider<ThemeProvider>.
  This usually happens when you are creating a provider and trying to read it immediately.

  For example, instead of:

  ```
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return Provider<Example>(
      create: (_) => Example(),
      // Will throw a ProviderNotFoundError, because `context` is associated
      // to the widget that is the parent of `Provider<Example>`
      child: Text(context.watch<Example>().toString()),
    );
  }
  ```

  consider using `builder` like so:

  ```
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return Provider<Example>(
      create: (_) => Example(),
      // we use `builder` to obtain a new `BuildContext` that has access to the provider
      builder: (context, child) {
        // No longer throws
        return Text(context.watch<Example>().toString());
      }
    );
  }
  ```

If none of these solutions work, consider asking for help on StackOverflow:
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/flutter

â•â•â•¡ EXCEPTION CAUGHT BY WIDGETS LIBRARY â•žâ•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•
The following ProviderNotFoundException was thrown building
HomeScreen-[LabeledGlobalKey<NavigatorState>#f5e90](dirty, dependencies: [InheritedCupertinoTheme,
MediaQuery, _InheritedTheme, _LocalizationsScope-[GlobalKey#b611a]], state:
_HomeScreenState#ccc60(tickers: tracking 3 tickers)):
Error: Could not find the correct Provider<ThemeProvider> above this HomeScreen Widget

This happens because you used a `BuildContext` that does not include the provider
of your choice. There are a few common scenarios:

- You added a new provider in your `main.dart` and performed a hot-reload.
  To fix, perform a hot-restart.

- The provider you are trying to read is in a different route.

  Providers are "scoped". So if you insert of provider inside a route, then
  other routes will not be able to access that provider.

- You used a `BuildContext` that is an ancestor of the provider you are trying to read.

  Make sure that HomeScreen is under your MultiProvider/Provider<ThemeProvider>.
  This usually happens when you are creating a provider and trying to read it immediately.

  For example, instead of:

  ```
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return Provider<Example>(
      create: (_) => Example(),
      // Will throw a ProviderNotFoundError, because `context` is associated
      // to the widget that is the parent of `Provider<Example>`
      child: Text(context.watch<Example>().toString()),
    );
  }
  ```

  consider using `builder` like so:

  ```
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return Provider<Example>(
      create: (_) => Example(),
      // we use `builder` to obtain a new `BuildContext` that has access to the provider
      builder: (context, child) {
        // No longer throws
        return Text(context.watch<Example>().toString());
      }
    );
  }
  ```

If none of these solutions work, consider asking for help on StackOverflow:
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/flutter

â•â•â•¡ EXCEPTION CAUGHT BY WIDGETS LIBRARY â•žâ•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•
The following ProviderNotFoundException was thrown building
HomeScreen-[LabeledGlobalKey<NavigatorState>#1a110](dirty, dependencies: [InheritedCupertinoTheme,
MediaQuery, _InheritedTheme, _LocalizationsScope-[GlobalKey#98e73]], state:
_HomeScreenState#cb360(tickers: tracking 3 tickers)):
Error: Could not find the correct Provider<ThemeProvider> above this HomeScreen Widget

This happens because you used a `BuildContext` that does not include the provider
of your choice. There are a few common scenarios:

- You added a new provider in your `main.dart` and performed a hot-reload.
  To fix, perform a hot-restart.

- The provider you are trying to read is in a different route.

  Providers are "scoped". So if you insert of provider inside a route, then
  other routes will not be able to access that provider.

- You used a `BuildContext` that is an ancestor of the provider you are trying to read.

  Make sure that HomeScreen is under your MultiProvider/Provider<ThemeProvider>.
  This usually happens when you are creating a provider and trying to read it immediately.

  For example, instead of:

  ```
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return Provider<Example>(
      create: (_) => Example(),
      // Will throw a ProviderNotFoundError, because `context` is associated
      // to the widget that is the parent of `Provider<Example>`
      child: Text(context.watch<Example>().toString()),
    );
  }
  ```

  consider using `builder` like so:

  ```
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return Provider<Example>(
      create: (_) => Example(),
      // we use `builder` to obtain a new `BuildContext` that has access to the provider
      builder: (context, child) {
        // No longer throws
        return Text(context.watch<Example>().toString());
      }
    );
  }
  ```

If none of these solutions work, consider asking for help on StackOverflow:
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/flutter

â•â•â•¡ EXCEPTION CAUGHT BY WIDGETS LIBRARY â•žâ•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•
The following ProviderNotFoundException was thrown building
HomeScreen-[LabeledGlobalKey<NavigatorState>#a6c96](dirty, dependencies: [InheritedCupertinoTheme,
MediaQuery, _InheritedTheme, _LocalizationsScope-[GlobalKey#ce227]], state:
_HomeScreenState#dbdea(tickers: tracking 3 tickers)):
Error: Could not find the correct Provider<ThemeProvider> above this HomeScreen Widget

This happens because you used a `BuildContext` that does not include the provider
of your choice. There are a few common scenarios:

- You added a new provider in your `main.dart` and performed a hot-reload.
  To fix, perform a hot-restart.

- The provider you are trying to read is in a different route.

  Providers are "scoped". So if you insert of provider inside a route, then
  other routes will not be able to access that provider.

- You used a `BuildContext` that is an ancestor of the provider you are trying to read.

  Make sure that HomeScreen is under your MultiProvider/Provider<ThemeProvider>.
  This usually happens when you are creating a provider and trying to read it immediately.

  For example, instead of:

  ```
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return Provider<Example>(
      create: (_) => Example(),
      // Will throw a ProviderNotFoundError, because `context` is associated
      // to the widget that is the parent of `Provider<Example>`
      child: Text(context.watch<Example>().toString()),
    );
  }
  ```

  consider using `builder` like so:

  ```
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return Provider<Example>(
      create: (_) => Example(),
      // we use `builder` to obtain a new `BuildContext` that has access to the provider
      builder: (context, child) {
        // No longer throws
        return Text(context.watch<Example>().toString());
      }
    );
  }
  ```

If none of these solutions work, consider asking for help on StackOverflow:
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/flutter

â•â•â•¡ EXCEPTION CAUGHT BY WIDGETS LIBRARY â•žâ•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•
The following ProviderNotFoundException was thrown building
HomeScreen-[LabeledGlobalKey<NavigatorState>#47bd0](dirty, dependencies: [InheritedCupertinoTheme,
MediaQuery, _InheritedTheme, _LocalizationsScope-[GlobalKey#59b6b]], state:
_HomeScreenState#9abb9(tickers: tracking 3 tickers)):
Error: Could not find the correct Provider<ThemeProvider> above this HomeScreen Widget

This happens because you used a `BuildContext` that does not include the provider
of your choice. There are a few common scenarios:

- You added a new provider in your `main.dart` and performed a hot-reload.
  To fix, perform a hot-restart.

- The provider you are trying to read is in a different route.

  Providers are "scoped". So if you insert of provider inside a route, then
  other routes will not be able to access that provider.

- You used a `BuildContext` that is an ancestor of the provider you are trying to read.

  Make sure that HomeScreen is under your MultiProvider/Provider<ThemeProvider>.
  This usually happens when you are creating a provider and trying to read it immediately.

  For example, instead of:

  ```
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return Provider<Example>(
      create: (_) => Example(),
      // Will throw a ProviderNotFoundError, because `context` is associated
      // to the widget that is the parent of `Provider<Example>`
      child: Text(context.watch<Example>().toString()),
    );
  }
  ```

  consider using `builder` like so:

  ```
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return Provider<Example>(
      create: (_) => Example(),
      // we use `builder` to obtain a new `BuildContext` that has access to the provider
      builder: (context, child) {
        // No longer throws
        return Text(context.watch<Example>().toString());
      }
    );
  }
  ```

If none of these solutions work, consider asking for help on StackOverflow:
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/flutter

The relevant error-causing widget was:
  HomeScreen-[LabeledGlobalKey<NavigatorState>#47bd0]
  HomeScreen:file:///Users/nishantgupta/Documents/GitaGyan/OldWisdom/lib/screens/root_scaffold.dart:127:12

#3      _HomeScreenState.build (package:GitaWisdom/screens/home_screen.dart:219:35)

â•â•â•¡ EXCEPTION CAUGHT BY WIDGETS LIBRARY â•žâ•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•
The following ProviderNotFoundException was thrown building
HomeScreen-[LabeledGlobalKey<NavigatorState>#9091e](dirty, dependencies: [InheritedCupertinoTheme,
MediaQuery, _InheritedTheme, _LocalizationsScope-[GlobalKey#88643]], state:
_HomeScreenState#fc110(tickers: tracking 3 tickers)):
Error: Could not find the correct Provider<ThemeProvider> above this HomeScreen Widget

This happens because you used a `BuildContext` that does not include the provider
of your choice. There are a few common scenarios:

- You added a new provider in your `main.dart` and performed a hot-reload.
  To fix, perform a hot-restart.

- The provider you are trying to read is in a different route.

  Providers are "scoped". So if you insert of provider inside a route, then
  other routes will not be able to access that provider.

- You used a `BuildContext` that is an ancestor of the provider you are trying to read.

  Make sure that HomeScreen is under your MultiProvider/Provider<ThemeProvider>.
  This usually happens when you are creating a provider and trying to read it immediately.

  For example, instead of:

  ```
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return Provider<Example>(
      create: (_) => Example(),
      // Will throw a ProviderNotFoundError, because `context` is associated
      // to the widget that is the parent of `Provider<Example>`
      child: Text(context.watch<Example>().toString()),
    );
  }
  ```

  consider using `builder` like so:

  ```
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return Provider<Example>(
      create: (_) => Example(),
      // we use `builder` to obtain a new `BuildContext` that has access to the provider
      builder: (context, child) {
        // No longer throws
        return Text(context.watch<Example>().toString());
      }
    );
  }
  ```

If none of these solutions work, consider asking for help on StackOverflow:
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/flutter

â•â•â•¡ EXCEPTION CAUGHT BY WIDGETS LIBRARY â•žâ•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•
The following ProviderNotFoundException was thrown building
HomeScreen-[LabeledGlobalKey<NavigatorState>#2913a](dirty, dependencies: [InheritedCupertinoTheme,
MediaQuery, _InheritedTheme, _LocalizationsScope-[GlobalKey#da92f]], state:
_HomeScreenState#1c9e2(tickers: tracking 3 tickers)):
Error: Could not find the correct Provider<ThemeProvider> above this HomeScreen Widget

This happens because you used a `BuildContext` that does not include the provider
of your choice. There are a few common scenarios:

- You added a new provider in your `main.dart` and performed a hot-reload.
  To fix, perform a hot-restart.

- The provider you are trying to read is in a different route.

  Providers are "scoped". So if you insert of provider inside a route, then
  other routes will not be able to access that provider.

- You used a `BuildContext` that is an ancestor of the provider you are trying to read.

  Make sure that HomeScreen is under your MultiProvider/Provider<ThemeProvider>.
  This usually happens when you are creating a provider and trying to read it immediately.

  For example, instead of:

  ```
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return Provider<Example>(
      create: (_) => Example(),
      // Will throw a ProviderNotFoundError, because `context` is associated
      // to the widget that is the parent of `Provider<Example>`
      child: Text(context.watch<Example>().toString()),
    );
  }
  ```

  consider using `builder` like so:

  ```
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return Provider<Example>(
      create: (_) => Example(),
      // we use `builder` to obtain a new `BuildContext` that has access to the provider
      builder: (context, child) {
        // No longer throws
        return Text(context.watch<Example>().toString());
      }
    );
  }
  ```

If none of these solutions work, consider asking for help on StackOverflow:
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/flutter

â•â•â•¡ EXCEPTION CAUGHT BY WIDGETS LIBRARY â•žâ•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•
The following ProviderNotFoundException was thrown building
HomeScreen-[LabeledGlobalKey<NavigatorState>#23bdb](dirty, dependencies: [InheritedCupertinoTheme,
MediaQuery, _InheritedTheme, _LocalizationsScope-[GlobalKey#7be63]], state:
_HomeScreenState#3c748(tickers: tracking 3 tickers)):
Error: Could not find the correct Provider<ThemeProvider> above this HomeScreen Widget

This happens because you used a `BuildContext` that does not include the provider
of your choice. There are a few common scenarios:

- You added a new provider in your `main.dart` and performed a hot-reload.
  To fix, perform a hot-restart.

- The provider you are trying to read is in a different route.

  Providers are "scoped". So if you insert of provider inside a route, then
  other routes will not be able to access that provider.

- You used a `BuildContext` that is an ancestor of the provider you are trying to read.

  Make sure that HomeScreen is under your MultiProvider/Provider<ThemeProvider>.
  This usually happens when you are creating a provider and trying to read it immediately.

  For example, instead of:

  ```
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return Provider<Example>(
      create: (_) => Example(),
      // Will throw a ProviderNotFoundError, because `context` is associated
      // to the widget that is the parent of `Provider<Example>`
      child: Text(context.watch<Example>().toString()),
    );
  }
  ```

  consider using `builder` like so:

  ```
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return Provider<Example>(
      create: (_) => Example(),
      // we use `builder` to obtain a new `BuildContext` that has access to the provider
      builder: (context, child) {
        // No longer throws
        return Text(context.watch<Example>().toString());
      }
    );
  }
  ```

If none of these solutions work, consider asking for help on StackOverflow:
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/flutter

â•â•â•¡ EXCEPTION CAUGHT BY WIDGETS LIBRARY â•žâ•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•
The following ProviderNotFoundException was thrown building
HomeScreen-[LabeledGlobalKey<NavigatorState>#cafe2](dirty, dependencies: [InheritedCupertinoTheme,
MediaQuery, _InheritedTheme, _LocalizationsScope-[GlobalKey#14682]], state:
_HomeScreenState#8585b(tickers: tracking 3 tickers)):
Error: Could not find the correct Provider<ThemeProvider> above this HomeScreen Widget

This happens because you used a `BuildContext` that does not include the provider
of your choice. There are a few common scenarios:

- You added a new provider in your `main.dart` and performed a hot-reload.
  To fix, perform a hot-restart.

- The provider you are trying to read is in a different route.

  Providers are "scoped". So if you insert of provider inside a route, then
  other routes will not be able to access that provider.

- You used a `BuildContext` that is an ancestor of the provider you are trying to read.

  Make sure that HomeScreen is under your MultiProvider/Provider<ThemeProvider>.
  This usually happens when you are creating a provider and trying to read it immediately.

  For example, instead of:

  ```
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return Provider<Example>(
      create: (_) => Example(),
      // Will throw a ProviderNotFoundError, because `context` is associated
      // to the widget that is the parent of `Provider<Example>`
      child: Text(context.watch<Example>().toString()),
    );
  }
  ```

  consider using `builder` like so:

  ```
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return Provider<Example>(
      create: (_) => Example(),
      // we use `builder` to obtain a new `BuildContext` that has access to the provider
      builder: (context, child) {
        // No longer throws
        return Text(context.watch<Example>().toString());
      }
    );
  }
  ```

If none of these solutions work, consider asking for help on StackOverflow:
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/flutter

The following ProviderNotFoundException was thrown building
HomeScreen-[LabeledGlobalKey<NavigatorState>#512f4](dirty, dependencies: [InheritedCupertinoTheme,
MediaQuery, _InheritedTheme, _LocalizationsScope-[GlobalKey#8b4e0]], state:
_HomeScreenState#47657(tickers: tracking 3 tickers)):
Error: Could not find the correct Provider<ThemeProvider> above this HomeScreen Widget

This happens because you used a `BuildContext` that does not include the provider
of your choice. There are a few common scenarios:

- You added a new provider in your `main.dart` and performed a hot-reload.
  To fix, perform a hot-restart.

- The provider you are trying to read is in a different route.

  Providers are "scoped". So if you insert of provider inside a route, then
  other routes will not be able to access that provider.

- You used a `BuildContext` that is an ancestor of the provider you are trying to read.

  Make sure that HomeScreen is under your MultiProvider/Provider<ThemeProvider>.
  This usually happens when you are creating a provider and trying to read it immediately.

  For example, instead of:

  ```
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return Provider<Example>(
      create: (_) => Example(),
      // Will throw a ProviderNotFoundError, because `context` is associated
      // to the widget that is the parent of `Provider<Example>`
      child: Text(context.watch<Example>().toString()),
    );
  }
  ```

  consider using `builder` like so:

  ```
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return Provider<Example>(
      create: (_) => Example(),
      // we use `builder` to obtain a new `BuildContext` that has access to the provider
      builder: (context, child) {
        // No longer throws
        return Text(context.watch<Example>().toString());
      }
    );
  }
  ```

If none of these solutions work, consider asking for help on StackOverflow:
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/flutter

â•â•â•¡ EXCEPTION CAUGHT BY FLUTTER TEST FRAMEWORK â•žâ•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•
The following TestFailure was thrown running a test:
Expected: null
  Actual: ProviderNotFoundException:<Error: Could not find the correct Provider<ThemeProvider> above
this HomeScreen Widget

          This happens because you used a `BuildContext` that does not include the provider
          of your choice. There are a few common scenarios:

          - You added a new provider in your `main.dart` and performed a hot-reload.
            To fix, perform a hot-restart.

          - The provider you are trying to read is in a different route.

            Providers are "scoped". So if you insert of provider inside a route, then
            other routes will not be able to access that provider.

          - You used a `BuildContext` that is an ancestor of the provider you are trying to read.

            Make sure that HomeScreen is under your MultiProvider/Provider<ThemeProvider>.
            This usually happens when you are creating a provider and trying to read it immediately.

            For example, instead of:

            ```
            Widget build(BuildContext context) {
              return Provider<Example>(
                create: (_) => Example(),
                // Will throw a ProviderNotFoundError, because `context` is associated
                // to the widget that is the parent of `Provider<Example>`
                child: Text(context.watch<Example>().toString()),
              );
            }
            ```

            consider using `builder` like so:

            ```
            Widget build(BuildContext context) {
              return Provider<Example>(
                create: (_) => Example(),
                // we use `builder` to obtain a new `BuildContext` that has access to the provider
                builder: (context, child) {
                  // No longer throws
                  return Text(context.watch<Example>().toString());
                }
              );
            }
            ```

          If none of these solutions work, consider asking for help on StackOverflow:
          https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/flutter
          >

The following ProviderNotFoundException was thrown building
HomeScreen-[LabeledGlobalKey<NavigatorState>#11772](dirty, dependencies: [InheritedCupertinoTheme,
MediaQuery, _InheritedTheme, _LocalizationsScope-[GlobalKey#65b61]], state:
_HomeScreenState#7ad6b(tickers: tracking 3 tickers)):
Error: Could not find the correct Provider<ThemeProvider> above this HomeScreen Widget

This happens because you used a `BuildContext` that does not include the provider
of your choice. There are a few common scenarios:

- You added a new provider in your `main.dart` and performed a hot-reload.
  To fix, perform a hot-restart.

- The provider you are trying to read is in a different route.

  Providers are "scoped". So if you insert of provider inside a route, then
  other routes will not be able to access that provider.

- You used a `BuildContext` that is an ancestor of the provider you are trying to read.

  Make sure that HomeScreen is under your MultiProvider/Provider<ThemeProvider>.
  This usually happens when you are creating a provider and trying to read it immediately.

  For example, instead of:

  ```
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return Provider<Example>(
      create: (_) => Example(),
      // Will throw a ProviderNotFoundError, because `context` is associated
      // to the widget that is the parent of `Provider<Example>`
      child: Text(context.watch<Example>().toString()),
    );
  }
  ```

  consider using `builder` like so:

  ```
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return Provider<Example>(
      create: (_) => Example(),
      // we use `builder` to obtain a new `BuildContext` that has access to the provider
      builder: (context, child) {
        // No longer throws
        return Text(context.watch<Example>().toString());
      }
    );
  }
  ```

If none of these solutions work, consider asking for help on StackOverflow:
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/flutter

â•â•â•¡ EXCEPTION CAUGHT BY WIDGETS LIBRARY â•žâ•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•
The following ProviderNotFoundException was thrown building
HomeScreen-[LabeledGlobalKey<NavigatorState>#11772](dirty, dependencies: [InheritedCupertinoTheme,
MediaQuery, _InheritedTheme, _LocalizationsScope-[GlobalKey#65b61]], state:
_HomeScreenState#7ad6b(tickers: tracking 3 tickers)):
Error: Could not find the correct Provider<ThemeProvider> above this HomeScreen Widget

This happens because you used a `BuildContext` that does not include the provider
of your choice. There are a few common scenarios:

- You added a new provider in your `main.dart` and performed a hot-reload.
  To fix, perform a hot-restart.

- The provider you are trying to read is in a different route.

  Providers are "scoped". So if you insert of provider inside a route, then
  other routes will not be able to access that provider.

- You used a `BuildContext` that is an ancestor of the provider you are trying to read.

  Make sure that HomeScreen is under your MultiProvider/Provider<ThemeProvider>.
  This usually happens when you are creating a provider and trying to read it immediately.

  For example, instead of:

  ```
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return Provider<Example>(
      create: (_) => Example(),
      // Will throw a ProviderNotFoundError, because `context` is associated
      // to the widget that is the parent of `Provider<Example>`
      child: Text(context.watch<Example>().toString()),
    );
  }
  ```

  consider using `builder` like so:

  ```
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return Provider<Example>(
      create: (_) => Example(),
      // we use `builder` to obtain a new `BuildContext` that has access to the provider
      builder: (context, child) {
        // No longer throws
        return Text(context.watch<Example>().toString());
      }
    );
  }
  ```

If none of these solutions work, consider asking for help on StackOverflow:
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/flutter

The following assertion was thrown during layout:
A RenderFlex overflowed by 25 pixels on the right.

The relevant error-causing widget was:
  Row
  Row:file:///Users/nishantgupta/Documents/GitaGyan/OldWisdom/lib/screens/scenario_detail_view.dart:281:31

The overflowing RenderFlex has an orientation of Axis.horizontal.
The edge of the RenderFlex that is overflowing has been marked in the rendering with a yellow and
black striped pattern. This is usually caused by the contents being too big for the RenderFlex.
Consider applying a flex factor (e.g. using an Expanded widget) to force the children of the
RenderFlex to fit within the available space instead of being sized to their natural size.
This is considered an error condition because it indicates that there is content that cannot be
seen. If the content is legitimately bigger than the available space, consider clipping it with a
ClipRect widget before putting it in the flex, or using a scrollable container rather than a Flex,
like a ListView.
The specific RenderFlex in question is: RenderFlex#435f8 relayoutBoundary=up14 OVERFLOWING:
  creator: Row â† Column â† Padding â† Semantics â† DefaultTextStyle â† AnimatedDefaultTextStyle â†
    _InkFeatures-[GlobalKey#5b010 ink renderer] â† NotificationListener<LayoutChangedNotification> â†
    CustomPaint â† _ShapeBorderPaint â† PhysicalShape â† _MaterialInterior â† â‹¯
  parentData: offset=Offset(0.0, 105.0); flex=null; fit=null (can use size)
  constraints: BoxConstraints(0.0<=w<=232.0, 0.0<=h<=Infinity)

â•â•â•¡ EXCEPTION CAUGHT BY WIDGETS LIBRARY â•žâ•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•
The following ProviderNotFoundException was thrown building
HomeScreen-[LabeledGlobalKey<NavigatorState>#4503f](dirty, dependencies: [InheritedCupertinoTheme,
MediaQuery, _InheritedTheme, _LocalizationsScope-[GlobalKey#c10b1]], state:
_HomeScreenState#fd642(tickers: tracking 3 tickers)):
Error: Could not find the correct Provider<ThemeProvider> above this HomeScreen Widget

This happens because you used a `BuildContext` that does not include the provider
of your choice. There are a few common scenarios:

- You added a new provider in your `main.dart` and performed a hot-reload.
  To fix, perform a hot-restart.

- The provider you are trying to read is in a different route.

  Providers are "scoped". So if you insert of provider inside a route, then
  other routes will not be able to access that provider.

- You used a `BuildContext` that is an ancestor of the provider you are trying to read.

  Make sure that HomeScreen is under your MultiProvider/Provider<ThemeProvider>.
  This usually happens when you are creating a provider and trying to read it immediately.

  For example, instead of:

  ```
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return Provider<Example>(
      create: (_) => Example(),
      // Will throw a ProviderNotFoundError, because `context` is associated
      // to the widget that is the parent of `Provider<Example>`
      child: Text(context.watch<Example>().toString()),
    );
  }
  ```

  consider using `builder` like so:

  ```
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return Provider<Example>(
      create: (_) => Example(),
      // we use `builder` to obtain a new `BuildContext` that has access to the provider
      builder: (context, child) {
        // No longer throws
        return Text(context.watch<Example>().toString());
      }
    );
  }
  ```

If none of these solutions work, consider asking for help on StackOverflow:
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/flutter

The following ProviderNotFoundException was thrown building
HomeScreen-[LabeledGlobalKey<NavigatorState>#31ef8](dirty, dependencies: [InheritedCupertinoTheme,
MediaQuery, _InheritedTheme, _LocalizationsScope-[GlobalKey#8591f]], state:
_HomeScreenState#70ee7(tickers: tracking 3 tickers)):
Error: Could not find the correct Provider<ThemeProvider> above this HomeScreen Widget

This happens because you used a `BuildContext` that does not include the provider
of your choice. There are a few common scenarios:

- You added a new provider in your `main.dart` and performed a hot-reload.
  To fix, perform a hot-restart.

- The provider you are trying to read is in a different route.

  Providers are "scoped". So if you insert of provider inside a route, then
  other routes will not be able to access that provider.

- You used a `BuildContext` that is an ancestor of the provider you are trying to read.

  Make sure that HomeScreen is under your MultiProvider/Provider<ThemeProvider>.
  This usually happens when you are creating a provider and trying to read it immediately.

  For example, instead of:

  ```
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return Provider<Example>(
      create: (_) => Example(),
      // Will throw a ProviderNotFoundError, because `context` is associated
      // to the widget that is the parent of `Provider<Example>`
      child: Text(context.watch<Example>().toString()),
    );
  }
  ```

  consider using `builder` like so:

  ```
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return Provider<Example>(
      create: (_) => Example(),
      // we use `builder` to obtain a new `BuildContext` that has access to the provider
      builder: (context, child) {
        // No longer throws
        return Text(context.watch<Example>().toString());
      }
    );
  }
  ```

If none of these solutions work, consider asking for help on StackOverflow:
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/flutter

The following ProviderNotFoundException was thrown building
HomeScreen-[LabeledGlobalKey<NavigatorState>#31ef8](dirty, dependencies: [InheritedCupertinoTheme,
MediaQuery, _InheritedTheme, _LocalizationsScope-[GlobalKey#8591f]], state:
_HomeScreenState#70ee7(tickers: tracking 3 tickers)):
Error: Could not find the correct Provider<ThemeProvider> above this HomeScreen Widget

This happens because you used a `BuildContext` that does not include the provider
of your choice. There are a few common scenarios:

- You added a new provider in your `main.dart` and performed a hot-reload.
  To fix, perform a hot-restart.

- The provider you are trying to read is in a different route.

  Providers are "scoped". So if you insert of provider inside a route, then
  other routes will not be able to access that provider.

- You used a `BuildContext` that is an ancestor of the provider you are trying to read.

  Make sure that HomeScreen is under your MultiProvider/Provider<ThemeProvider>.
  This usually happens when you are creating a provider and trying to read it immediately.

  For example, instead of:

  ```
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return Provider<Example>(
      create: (_) => Example(),
      // Will throw a ProviderNotFoundError, because `context` is associated
      // to the widget that is the parent of `Provider<Example>`
      child: Text(context.watch<Example>().toString()),
    );
  }
  ```

  consider using `builder` like so:

  ```
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return Provider<Example>(
      create: (_) => Example(),
      // we use `builder` to obtain a new `BuildContext` that has access to the provider
      builder: (context, child) {
        // No longer throws
        return Text(context.watch<Example>().toString());
      }
    );
  }
  ```

If none of these solutions work, consider asking for help on StackOverflow:
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/flutter

01:26 +733 -175: /Users/nishantgupta/Documents/GitaGyan/OldWisdom/test/services/notification_permission_service_test.dart: NotificationPermissionService - Settings openSettings should not throw errors
Typically, this is done by calling "WidgetsFlutterBinding.ensureInitialized()" or "runApp()" (the latter calls the former). Typically this call is done in the "void main()" method. The "ensureInitialized" method is idempotent; calling it multiple times is not harmful. After calling that method, the "instance" getter will return the binding.
In a test, one can call "TestWidgetsFlutterBinding.ensureInitialized()" as the first line in the test's "main()" method to initialize the binding.
If ServicesBinding is a custom binding mixin, there must also be a custom binding class, like WidgetsFlutterBinding, but that mixes in the selected binding, and that is the class that must be constructed before using the "instance" getter.

The following assertion was thrown during layout:
A RenderFlex overflowed by 9.2 pixels on the right.

The relevant error-causing widget was:
  Row
  Row:file:///Users/nishantgupta/Documents/GitaGyan/OldWisdom/lib/widgets/error_widgets.dart:111:13

The overflowing RenderFlex has an orientation of Axis.horizontal.
The edge of the RenderFlex that is overflowing has been marked in the rendering with a yellow and
black striped pattern. This is usually caused by the contents being too big for the RenderFlex.
Consider applying a flex factor (e.g. using an Expanded widget) to force the children of the
RenderFlex to fit within the available space instead of being sized to their natural size.
This is considered an error condition because it indicates that there is content that cannot be
seen. If the content is legitimately bigger than the available space, consider clipping it with a
ClipRect widget before putting it in the flex, or using a scrollable container rather than a Flex,
like a ListView.

    AnimatedBuilder â† â‹¯

  direction: horizontal
  mainAxisAlignment: center
  mainAxisSize: max
  crossAxisAlignment: center
  textDirection: ltr
  verticalDirection: down
  spacing: 0.0
